content:
Yes, there are several countries that are leading the way in using renewable energy. 

One of the most notable countries is Iceland, which has almost 100% of its electricity generated from renewable energy sources, particularly geothermal and hydropower.

Another country that is at the forefront of renewable energy usage is Denmark. Denmark has been investing in wind power since the 1970s and currently generates approximately 47% of its electricity from wind power. 

Costa Rica has also made significant strides in using renewable energy sources, generating over 95% of its power from renewable hydropower, geothermal, wind, and solar sources.

Other countries that are making significant investments in renewable energy include Norway, Portugal, Germany, Sweden, and the Netherlands.

Many developing countries, particularly in Africa, are also embracing renewable energy sources due to its accessibility and affordability. 

Overall, the adoption of renewable energy around the world continues to grow as nations recognize the potential to reduce their carbon footprint and advance towards a more sustainable future.
